oai_dc:dc.dc:title: United States voucher given to Mrs. E. McGavock and daughters

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Forage
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: United States voucher given to Mrs. E. McGavock and her daughters for corn supplied on October 27, December 14, December 15, December 16, December 21, and December 23, equaling 2,160 bushels of corn and $1,080.00. The voucher was collected by Cynthia McGavock and the money was appropriated by her and Margaret McGavock.

The U.S. Army relied heavily on impressed goods while on campaign. While the Quartermaster furnished rations and other goods for the army, many items, such as horses, mules, wood, and animal feed, were often taken from the local population.
